steps_to_prepare: 1. Crack eggs into a bowl, add a splash of water or milk, and whisk until frothy. Season with salt and pepper.
2. Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the spinach and cook for 1-2 minutes until wilted.
4. Pour the egg mixture over the spinach.
5. Gently stir and fold the eggs as they cook until they reach your desired doneness (about 3-4 minutes).
6. If using, sprinkle cheese over the top during the last minute of cooking.
tips_and_tricks: For extra protein, add a scoop of unflavored protein powder to the eggs before whisking. Serve with a slice of whole-wheat toast if it fits your macros.

meal_name: Quick Toasted Bagel with Cream Cheese
steps_to_prepare: 1. Slice the bagel in half.
2. Toast the bagel to your desired level of crispness using a toaster or in a pan.
3. Spread cream cheese evenly on both halves of the warm bagel.
4. Serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: Choose whole wheat bagels for more fiber and sustained energy. Add a sprinkle of everything bagel seasoning for extra flavor.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground turkey and cook, breaking it apart, until no longer pink (about 7-8 minutes).
2. Drain any excess fat. Stir in the taco seasoning and 1/4 cup of water. Simmer for 3-4 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
3. While turkey cooks, heat black beans and cooked rice in the microwave.
4. Assemble your bowls: Divide the rice among bowls, then top with the cooked turkey, black beans, shredded lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
5. Save half of the cooked turkey for Turkey Tacos later in the week.
tips_and_tricks: To save time, use pre-cooked rice pouches. This bowl is great for meal prep; store components separately and assemble before eating.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
steps_to_prepare: 1. Heat olive oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
2. Add the chicken pieces and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until golden and cooked through.
3. Add the frozen vegetables to the skillet and cook for another 4-5 minutes, stirring frequently, until crisp-tender.
4. Reduce heat to low, pour in the teriyaki sauce, and stir to coat everything evenly. Let it simmer for 1-2 minutes.
5. Serve immediately over a bed of warm rice.
6. Set aside about 1/3 of the chicken and veggies for the Upgraded Ramen meal.
tips_and_tricks: For a flavor boost, add minced garlic or ginger with the chicken. A sprinkle of sesame seeds on top adds a nice touch.

steps_to_prepare: 1. In a small pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Gently add the egg and cook for 7 minutes for a jammy yolk. Remove with a slotted spoon and run under cold water.
2. In the same pot, cook the instant ramen noodles according to package directions, adding the flavor packet.
3. During the last minute of cooking, stir in the baby spinach until it wilts.
4. Pour the ramen and broth into a bowl. Top with the leftover teriyaki chicken (reheated).
5. Peel the soft-boiled egg, slice it in half, and add it to the bowl.
tips_and_tricks: This meal is designed to use leftovers, making it extremely fast. You can add other leftover veggies as well.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
steps_to_prepare: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chicken pieces and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the sliced onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes until they begin to soften.
4. Pour the General Tso's sauce over the chicken and vegetables. Stir to coat and allow to simmer for 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
5. Serve hot over freshly cooked rice.
tips_and_tricks: Use a bag of frozen stir-fry vegetables instead of fresh onion and pepper to save even more prep time.

ingredients: Leftover cooked ground turkey from Day 1
steps_to_prepare: 1. Reheat the leftover seasoned ground turkey in a skillet or the microwave until hot.
2. Warm the flour tortillas in a dry pan for 30 seconds per side, or in the microwave for 30-45 seconds.
3. Assemble the tacos: Spoon the warm turkey into the tortillas.
4. Top with shredded lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
5. Serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: Add a dollop of Greek yogurt instead of sour cream for a high-protein, healthier alternative.

ingredients: Leftover veggies (e.g., sliced onion, bell pepper)
steps_to_prepare: 1. Cook hot dogs using your preferred method: pan-fry in a little oil for 5-7 minutes, or boil in water for 4-6 minutes.
2. Lightly toast the hot dog buns in a pan or toaster oven.
3. While hot dogs cook, prepare the side salad. In a bowl, toss the shredded lettuce and any leftover chopped veggies.
4. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar (if using), salt, and pepper for a simple vinaigrette and toss with the salad.
5. Place cooked hot dogs in the buns and serve with the side salad.
tips_and_tricks: Choose nitrate-free or chicken/turkey hot dogs for a healthier option. Add your favorite condiments like mustard or ketchup.

ingredients: Optional toppings: leftover cooked meat, leftover veggies
steps_to_prepare: 1. Preheat your oven broiler or a toaster oven to high. You can also do this in a large, dry skillet on the stovetop.
2. Place tortillas on a baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of salsa or tomato sauce over each tortilla, leaving a small border.
4. Sprinkle evenly with shredded cheese.
5. Add any leftover cooked meats (like hot dogs, turkey, or chicken) or veggies you have on hand. For a 'pepperoni' flavor, use thinly sliced hot dogs.
6. Broil for 2-4 minutes, or pan-fry on medium heat, until the cheese is bubbly and the tortilla is crisp. Watch carefully to prevent burning.
tips_and_tricks: This is a perfect end-of-week meal to use up any remaining ingredients. Almost anything can be a pizza topping!
appliances_and_utensils: Oven with broiler or Toaster Oven or Skillet

steps_to_prepare: 1. In a microwave-safe mug, add the brownie mix, water, and olive oil.
2. Stir with a fork until just combined. Do not overmix.
3. Microwave on high for 60-90 seconds. The brownie will puff up and should look cooked but still be slightly gooey in the center.
4. Let it cool for a minute before eating. Be careful, the mug will be hot.
5. Top with a small scoop of Greek yogurt if desired.
tips_and_tricks: Use a standard-sized coffee mug to prevent overflow. If you don't have brownie mix, you can make it from scratch with flour, sugar, cocoa powder, oil, and water.
